title: Your pictures on the theme of 'my hobby'
description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "my hobby".

title: Covid-19 vaccines: William 'proud' of Queen and Philip for having jab
description: The Duke of Cambridge praises his grandparents for getting the vaccine in a video call with NHS staff.

title: Covid-19: Vaccine patients treated to live organ music while waiting for jab
description: People listened to the likes of Bach and Handel as they waited for their jab at Salisbury Cathedral.

title: Covid: Friends fined for 68-mile drive to visit McDonald's
description: Staffordshire Police stopped a car that had travelled from Manchester to Uttoxeter.

title: White House: The full-sized Oval Office replica in Norfolk
description: Part of the White House has been cloned in Norfolk, thousands of miles from Washington DC.

title: Aerial photos capture 'tree of life' structures in Norfolk and Suffolk
description: Mike Page says his images of the spectacular patterns capture a moment in time.

title: Autism: 'They said bleach would cure my daughter'
description: Black, Asian or minority ethnic people with autism have a "double whammy", campaigners say.

title: British and Irish Lions tour: Can Maro Itoje captain tour of South Africa?
description: Maro Itoje has never captained his country. He doesn't lead his club. So why do his team-mates think he could rugby's biggest job?

title: Covid: 'Urgent' aviation support plea over travel curbs
description: Air industry bodies call for more government support ahead of the UK travel corridor closure on Monday.

title: Coronavirus: EU anger over delayed Pfizer vaccine deliveries
description: Many EU countries are receiving significantly fewer doses due to a change in manufacturing processes.

title: The Papers: 'Fortress Britain' and 'modern miracle workers'
description: Most of Saturday's front pages focus on a decision to shut down all travel corridors to the UK.

title: Tennis stars' arrival angers stranded Australians
description: Players are flown in ahead of the Australian Open while thousands of citizens are waiting to return.

title: Covid: UK variant could drive 'rapid growth' in US cases, CDC warns
description: Health officials warn the highly contagious UK Covid variant could become the dominant strain by March.

title: Boris Johnson says girls' education key to ending poverty
description: The UK prime minister wants girls' education in developing countries to be a key international focus.

title: To poll or not to poll? That is still the question
description: Ministers seem set on England's May elections taking place, but some in local government are pushing back.

title: Capitol riots: What are far-right Trump supporters saying?
description: Members of the extreme right are searching for new online homes, amid paranoia that they are being ‘set up’ by the authorities.

title: New takeaway and shopping rules begin in Scotland
description: Takeaway outlets and click and collect retail services must change how they operate in Scotland.

title: Brexit: End to Gibraltar land border prompts joy and trepidation
description: For residents on both sides of the border there are hopes of an end to queues, but not everyone is convinced.

title: Did we see a Christmas coronavirus spike?
description: Christmas gatherings were cut back but was there still an impact on Covid cases?

title: US Election 2020: What do countries around the world want from Joe Biden?
description: We speak to reporters in six global regions about hopes and expectations for the new US administration.

title: Martin Luther King Jr: New documentary on FBI surveillance
description: New documentary highlights extent of the FBI surveillance of the US civil rights leader.

title: Dinosaurs In Love: Tom Rosenthal and daughter's song made into book
description: Dinosaurs In Love went viral, musician Tom Rosenthal and his daughter Fenn were the ones behind it.

title: Project 17: One girl's quest for clean water in Rwanda
description: Joyce, 17, explores progress towards the goal of clean water for all in her country, Rwanda.
